aboutSection.title: My profile
aboutSection.description:
Curious about many fields and eager to learn, I began my higher education in web design and multimedia. I then pursued my passion for video games with a Level Design degree, where I learned the fundamentals of game design. I further expanded my knowledge with a Master's in Game Design, during which I worked at Terebris on the puzzle game Terebron. To add new skills to my repertoire, I finally completed training as a software tester.

Passionate about the representation and manipulation of time in video games, I completed my Master's thesis on this subject.

Highly versatile, I have skills in Game Design as well as software testing. I also have a good understanding of programming and UX design. Observant and meticulous, I learn quickly and adapt easily to new situations. With my diverse skill set, I believe I can contribute to a wide range of teams.

skills.description: I was responsible for writing and updating design documents on numerous projects, whether it was gameplay documentation or level design documentation.
I participated in the design of core mechanics on numerous student and game jam projects. I am also responsible for new mechanics on projects such as Terebron and SilverLining.
I created over 150 levels for Terebron. I also designed the entire game space for Hikikomori and created a large part of the map for SilverLining.
I was in charge of balancing the difficulty of the levels in Terebron. I am also responsible for balancing the game feel in Bisbille.

I conducted various types of tests across several projects, including functional tests to verify the proper functioning of applications, as well as non-functional tests such as performance and interface tests, to ensure the overall quality of the product.
I am proficient with bug reporting and tracking tools such as JIRA and Trello.
I was able to design a test strategy by implementing test cases, a test plan, and a schedule.
On Terebron, I worked on some localization and its integration. I was also responsible for checking and correcting localization errors.
I had the opportunity to create automated test scripts with Cypress.
I had the opportunity to participate in numerous playtests. I also supervised, monitored, and analyzed various playtests.
Thanks to my training and experience in web design, I have strong skills in ergonomics
On Terebron, I redesigned the game interface, the menu interface, and created the entire level editor interface.
I have designed numerous interface prototypes using tools such as Figma and Adobe XD.
I designed the mobile version of Terebron's interface. I also ensure that my websites are responsive and mobile-friendly.

Having worked on Terebron, developed in Unity, I am very comfortable with using and integrating content in Unity. Additionally, due to the many games and prototypes developed during my studies, I am also very familiar with Unreal Engine.

Having created numerous projects in JavaScript (websites, applications, mini-games), I have a strong proficiency in this language. I have also developed several projects in React (including this portfolio).
I have programmed several prototypes using Blueprints, including Jekyll and Hyde and Alice.

education.name: Software tester
education.description: Training focused on test methodologies, using bug reporting tools, and test automation.

education.name: Master Game Design
education.description: This Master's program with alternating work-study periods trains experts in video game design. It includes courses in Game Design, Programming, and Narrative Design, applied through the development of numerous game projects.

education.name: Bachelor Level Design
education.description: This one-year training program teaches the fundamentals of game design. It covers Game Design, Level Design, storytelling, and the use of game engines Unreal Engine and Unity.

education.name: Degree web design
education.description: A multidisciplinary training program aimed at teaching web design and multimedia projects. It covers ergonomics and JavaScript, as well as the entire Adobe suite.
